commit.title: [stm] Remove `opacity_guarantee` from the classification.
commit.message:
[stm] Remove `opacity_guarantee` from the classification.

Semantics of this flag is really weird, as in particular, it is
overriding the core opacity setting in `Proof_global`.

If we want this feature back, it should be integrated in the core
declaration mechanism [which sadly is quite messy at the moment].

Anyways I would just go ahead and deprecate/remove the `derive`
plugin, it seems to me that the cost it imposes in terms of API to the
rest of the system is pretty large given the perceived number of
users.

declaration mechanism [which sadly is quite messy at the moment].

Anyways I would just go ahead and deprecate/remove the `derive`
plugin, it seems to me that the cost it imposes in terms of API to the
rest of the system is pretty large given the perceived number of
users.

commit.title: [stm] Remove `opacity_guarantee` from the classification.
commit.message:
[stm] Remove `opacity_guarantee` from the classification.

Semantics of this flag is really weird, as in particular, it is
overriding the core opacity setting in `Proof_global`.

If we want this feature back, it should be integrated in the core
declaration mechanism [which sadly is quite messy at the moment].

Anyways I would just go ahead and deprecate/remove the `derive`
plugin, it seems to me that the cost it imposes in terms of API to the
rest of the system is pretty large given the perceived number of
users.
